reviews.author: snow273
reviews.comment_content:
Some main topics (not all):
- A LOT of Integration (Definite integrals, integration by parts, improper integrals, area between curves, Volume, etc. )
- Polar Coordinates
- Series (Infinite sequence, infinite series, power series, Taylor series, Maclaurin series) and some tests
- Vectors (not included in final this semester)

I would say it’s quite a lot of content but reasonable as this is a math calculus course lol
Personally I find it still manageable (I took M1 in dse)
If you have background in calculus, especially M2 in dse for local students, the first half of the course would not be a big deal.
Good luck to those from MATH1012 lolllll
reviews.comment_teaching:
I did not listen to much of his lectures, but he seemed to explain things clearly and detailedly. His notes are quite good, including some useful examples, which are usually blank and has to refer to his solution posted after lectures. Be careful of some little errors made in the solutions though lol

As for tutorial, it will be useful if you are looking for ways to solve exam-related problems. The TA will give you some problems to work on and present the solution.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm has a mean of around 53/100. It is said to be absolute grading though. Not sure about that. The final result and grade have not been out yet.
reviews.comment_workload:
Compulsory: WebWork
Around 10 in total if only including those count toward the final grade.
Quite a light workload if you only finish WebWork exercises.
If you want to be familiar with the topics, much more time and hard work is needed, which means a greater workload.
There are some more revision exercises on WebWork this semester, good for practice and review. You can also make use of Clasviva for additional exercises, but the difficulty may not be comparable to exams.

reviews.author: bwlch
reviews.title: As Expected
reviews.comment_content:
Other comments should have shown some about the syllabus of the course, I would not repeat here.
For those who have studied M2, the first half of the course which is mainly about integration and its application would be rather handleable because it is more practical.
However, the second half of the course (not including vectors) is more theoretical and require you to have a clear understanding of each concept which may become quite troublesome.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture are more for theoretical concepts.
Tutorials are more for practical skills.
Professor Chiang's teaching is acceptable.
Professor Chiang usually provide a theory and give a proof or some examples about that theory. Simple but useful way to deliver rather hard concepts. Taking notes would be helpful such that you can revise the concepts after the Lecture. (To be honest, sometimes find his hand written notes in lectures to be more helpful than those notes he post on canvas)
Although providing the proof may help with understanding the theory, it also cause the paste of the lecture section to lack behind others. Resulting in the whole Taylor Series part (one of the rather difficult concepts) to be covered in like 1 lecture or so.
TA Henry Tsang is pretty good at explaining the concepts that needs to be focused on and is more helpful compare to some other TAs I would say. The tutorial for this sections is mainly doing the worksheet provided which is quite helpful in letting you know how to apply the concepts learned in lectures. You can choose to not come to the tutorial but you would definetely know more on how to tackle questions in exams if you come to the tutorial
reviews.comment_grading:
Don't know the grades yet.
Grading scheme:
10% WebWorks (HW 1~9 or 1~10)
35% Midterm Exam
55% Final Exam
Although it saids to follow absolute grading, sometimes it also depends on your classmates or students in other lecture sections.
For the exams, wish that they wouldn't skip any topic such that the question would not vary much from the past paper that they give you for reference.
reviews.comment_workload:
To get a good grade some hard work is needed. However, if you are just expecting to pass the course, the workload shouldn't be that heavy. As the instructors have said, they try to make it hard to fail the course.
For the homework, there is about 9-10 for the whole semester and the workload for that would be rather acceptable

reviews.author: Chingchaga
reviews.title: Welcome to this infamous course
reviews.comment_content:
Sequels for MATH 1012 / MATH 1013

Topics include applications of definite integral, improper integrals, vectors, curves and parametric equations, modeling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations, infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Do not rely on lectures, learn it yourself

If you come from MATH 1012, means that you don't have calculas basis in high school, and this course will very likely be extremely difficult for you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading rough divisions:

A+/A/A- > 85.5 > B+/B/B- >70.5 > C+/C/C- > 50.5 > D > 40  

10% WebWorks

35% by Mid-semester exam

55% by final exam
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much, only 9-10 HW on webwork

Remember to spend more time besides lectures and HW to understand the concept

reviews.author: Anson132
reviews.comment_content: The coverage is a bit too much but i think it is not a big deal.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturer is able to adjust the lecture with student comment which is nice, the TA in tutorial is also great and nice to provide a lot of help to students.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite tough since it is a competitive course. But don't worry, the grade must equal to the effort paid
reviews.comment_workload:
GOOD
only need to focus on mid term exam and final exam.
The tutorial sheet mark is deduced by the TA and TA is nice to give sufficient help to do the sheet which it should be a easy job to get the mark.

reviews.author: Tenmark
reviews.comment_content:
Including:
Application of integration (Area, volume, work done, arc length, surface area)
Integration (Basic integrals, chain rule, U-substitution,  trigonometric substitution, integration by parts, partial fraction, polar coordinate)
Numerical integration (Left-endpoint rule, right-endpoint rule, midpoint rule, trapezoid rule, Simpson's rule, error estimation)
Improper integral (infinite intervals, discontinuous integrands, p-test, comparison test)
Sequence, series (alternating series, integral test, power series, root test, ratio test)
Taylor series (Newton polynomials, Taylor expansion, maximum/ minimum revisited, L'hopital rule revisited)
Vector (dot product, cross product)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Chiang usually spends so much time on going through the proof of some thorems and identities. When there is a new topic/ concepts coming, he usually commences with some background and stories about it . If you missed a class, it is easy to get loss since the concepts are quite difficult to understand (Just check out Youtube if not familiar with the topic).
In-class exercises are provided and go through almost every lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorial worksheet 20%
Midterm 25%
Final 55%

Midterm mean, sd = 37.4, 19.51
Final mean, sd = 30.02, 15.09

Open book exams(unlimited hard copy of notes/ cheat sheets allowed), no electronic devices nor calculators allowed

Overall 6x , A- (People say it is absolute grading)
reviews.comment_workload:
Tutorial worksheet is not hard to finish and get full marks, just feel free to ask questions from tutor/ classmates if not sure the answer. Make sure you attend all the tutorial session becuase somehow the in-class exercises are way not enough to enable you to handle the exam (just attending tutor is also not enough though)
Bunch of webwork exercises are provided. Although it does not count any marks, some exam questions can be found from those webwork exercises. So if you are not confident about the topic, just keep grinding it and finish all the webwork provided.
Just adjust yourself and make your own plan.

reviews.author: KRKirian
reviews.title: Very challenging for Asso students
reviews.comment_content: Very challenging for Asso students. I would tell you what you have learnt in Asso is definitely not enough. I suggest you study MATH1013 first even if you can transfer credit. I have done the placement test and I thought that I can handle this course. However, the mid-term exam and final exam are much more difficult than the level of placement test.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would say the teaching is moderate.
reviews.comment_grading: I got overall 42% in this course and got a C, but this is because I am bad.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is good. No assignment at all.

reviews.author: PranavAgarwal
reviews.title: A good course if you put the effort in
reviews.comment_content:
IT is adquate amount of content, but the prof could not really pace the lectures well enough so some parts were a bit rushed.
- Area between curve
- Volumes
- Cylindrical shell
-work done
- averages
- integration
-arc length
-surface area
-polar coordinates, area, length
- Numerical integration
- improper integration
- sequences and series
- power series, taylor series
reviews.comment_teaching: It does get boring during lectures and sometimes it is better to self study but if you pay attention to class, it would pay off.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading, this grading scale speaks for itself.
reviews.comment_workload: Fall sem workload was nothing. We had no homeworks assignments etc. Just tutorial with mandatory attendence and lectures. Not too bad.

reviews.author: 日修運動服愛好者
reviews.title: A terrible course with absolute grading
reviews.comment_content:
Area and Volumes
Application of Integration: Work and Mean value
Integration
Polar Coordinates and Arc length
Integration by estimation
Improper Integrals
Series and Sequences
Vectors
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Chiang explain the concepts in detailed. However, I suggest you do not rely on his lecture notes given in the canvas, he gave the content simply by writing in the whiteboard. Therefore, I would suggest you taking hand-written notes in the lecture by the professor.
The progress of the course is very low that we have to take an extra lecture on finishing the last topic, which is vector. I was too rush to finish the exercise of vectors before final exam.

The TA-Henry Tsang was very good that he would explain some of the concepts and tricky questions in this course. You only need to finish the worksheet that he given for every tutorial session
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorial Attendence 20% (Dropped 3 worst marks )
Midterm 25% (11 multiple choices with 3 long questions)
Final 55% (18 multiple choices with 5 long questions)
Homework and problems were not counted in this semester

Although you can use a calculator for the midterm to answer the questions, you can't use it in the final exam, you have to compute the integral step by step in. Besides, the questions in the final exam were totally different from the midterm exam. Therefore, the mean for the final exam is totally lower than in midterm

Mean for midterm:39.1/80
Mean for final: 30.02/100
Final mean: 45.38%

My marks:
Midterm:47/80
Final: 21/100
Tutorial attendence: 10/12(Missed 2 tutorial sessions)
Final mark:42.9%
Grade: Miracally got a C

I would like to say that you will be very lucky if you can pass this course with a full effort, even though both midterm and final exam were open-booked in fall semester
reviews.comment_workload:
Unlike previous semester, this semester, the webwork marks is replaced by tutorial attendence, with 2 marks for doing every tutorial worksheet questions seriously. But I would like to suggest you to finish the webwork problems as the professor will modified these questions for midterm and final exam.
(Done all the homework problems but only did 6 exercises)

Besides, if you are calculator-feeded, make sure you need to learn how to compute the integral step-by-step in symbolab. as you cannot use a calculator during final exam. Computing the integral and vectors without calculator and desmos was too terrible for me in the final exam.
(The prof commented on our badly performance in the final exam without calculator)

Also, she will explain the theory in detail even though we had already understood the course materials. It really helps us to consolidate the basic knowledge and makes us to have a better understanding.

C+

reviews.comment_workload: Assigned with weekly homework only, tutorials could help us to tackle the problems. With self-learning progress, we could further adjust the learning progress from school. Without too fast or too slow, we can have our best schedule as we have set.

reviews.comment_grading:
people say that it is absolute grading and
Below 40% means a F

I got 43% and got a D, this somehow justified that it's absolute grading

I got full marks in the 10 HWs (you have unlimited trial), this contribute 25% of the Final result
The remaining 75% are from Final and 1 got
Part 1: 8/36 (mean 24.1)
Part 2: 8/32 (mean 20.2)
Part 3: 8/32 (mean 18.7)
*The mean score is for my lecture only not the overall mean of the course

My result shows that you only need 2 correct answer in each part to get a pass (4 marks per question)
Hope that this would help those who are struggling to get a pass in this course  
**Though getting a D (GPA 1.0) is really disastrous, try your best to drop this course if you're not confident with your math

btw this year we have our final in Canvas I dunno if the case would be the same in f2f exams

10 HW assignment
As I'm not good in Math

on average one per asm week

If you face any difficult question try scan through the tutorial notes of all 3 tutors, they might teaches it in their tutorial.

She has accent (acceptable) and the lesson is quite boring, I think maybe because she is a new teacher and not familiar with the online teaching so that there are some technical problems, and she was just repeating the PowerPoint instead of writing something to explain better. But she is very kind and helpful teacher, any questions you ask she will answer you, no matter in the class or through email (so that takes lots of time). Also, she willing to open another session (when I join in there are only 1 student) to run pre-final to help students to prepare well (the official session is 11am and I had lesson) which other sections don’t have. reviews.author: wtf522
reviews.title: Surprisingly not bad...
reviews.comment_content:
Just the usual stuff. You may look at other reviews for details in the curriculum.

New concepts for M2 students

reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally, I don't think Avery is a bad professor. Even though he does speak with a lot of fillers, his English is at least much more understandable than other Mainland professors. As a matter of fact, he does provide lecture notes. After each lecture, he would organise his notes and upload both his written and digital notes on Canvas. Some may say that he includes too many out-of-syllabus proofs in his teaching, but in my opinion, this helps me understand the content better. Therefore, I don't know why many would think Avery is a bad teacher. It is possible that he simply had changed though.

On the other hand, Phyllis is an excellent tutor as always. I skipped my original tutorials and went to hers in the last semester, and I am very glad that she has become my actual tutor this semester. Her notes are useful, and she explains the concepts clearly. Technically, just attending the tutorials is more than enough for this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
I understand that there is a global pandemic in this semester. However, the grading scheme is just utterly stupid. God knows why someone would think that cancelling the midterm would ease the cheating problem. And why in the world would someone consider making the final a 20 MCQ exam is an acceptable way of assessing students' performance? If you are not a careful student, good luck to you as you may drop one subgrade for every MC question you did wrong.

For your reference:
- Homework (25%): full
- Final (75%): 90/100 (mean: 70.41)
- Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: It is undeniable that the workload is very light. There is weekly homework on Classviva, but you should have more than enough time to finish that. There is only one final exam that accounts for 75% of your grade this semester. It is up to you to decide whether such a low workload is reasonable or not.

reviews.author: Python
reviews.title: Avery Ching Grade God!!
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, area between curves.
Week 2 Volumes by cross-sections, volumes by cylindrical shells.
Week 3 Work, average value of a function, arc length.
Week 4 Area of a surface of revolution, integration by parts.
Week 5 Trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitution.
Week 6 Polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions, summary of integration techniques.
Week 7 Approximation integration, improper integrals.
Week 8 Infinite sequences and series, integral test.
Week 9 Comparison tests, alternating series, absolute convergence, ratio and root tests
Week 10 Power series, represention of functions as power series .
Week 11 Taylor and Maclaurin series, applications of Taylor polynomials.
Week 12 Two and three dimensional coordinate systems, vectors.
Week 13 Dot product, cross product.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Similar to previous comments, he spoke with lots of 'uhh' inside his teaching which makes it really hard to understand what he said. The attendance rate was about 20%, what a pity==
His notes are total bullshxt, I relied on Dr Ho Hon Ming notes to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_grading:
Because of the mean of the midterm was 12.4/30, he adjusted the grading scheme so you can all in final to save your grade.

2 grading schemes:

15% webwork, 30% midterm, 55% final, 8% bonus quiz
or
15% webwork, 85% final, 8% bonus quiz

My score:
27/30 midterm
15% webwork
41/55 final
bonus quiz 6.2x/8
I expect an A- and he gave me an A+ lol

reviews.author: Peter_skc
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus mostly are calculus (integration by parts or substitution and involving trigonometry)

- Area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells
- Length of curves, surface area, work, average value of a function
- Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions
- Numerical integration, improper integrals
- Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series
- Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series
- Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross product
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture only, but somethings lecturers have mentioned may be present in final exam
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is extremely worse.

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.comment_content:
★★ Advanced Integration - Integration by Parts, Trigonometric Substitution, Volume of Revolution (Disc & Shell Methods), Integration to find Arc Length & Surface Area, Polar Coordinate Integration

★★★ Discontinuity, Convergence & Divergence of Functions (revisit lim x→∞)

★★ Arithmetic, Geometric, Finite, Infinite; Power, Taylor & Manchurian Series (e.g. e^x = 1 + x + x^2/2 + x^3/6 + x^4/24 + ...)

★ Vectors, Dot & Cross Product [the latter involved Determinant of Matrix for a·(b×c)]
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ho Hon Ming (not teaching MATH 1014 now) is the best teacher I have ever encountered.
Taught very fluently and clearly.

Gave out lots of detailed colored notes, placed on a black-rotary chair in the middle of the lecture hall every class. ONE set of notes for EACH person. NO taking MORE for any friends. Be punctual so that you can get it.

Showed a no. of examples, centering on common mistakes students usually made (e.g. 1^∞ ＝ 1, which is actually WRONG.)

DON'T miss lessons！

Dr. Lam (Course Coordinator) is very kind and compassionate. He taught as equally good as Dr. Ho, but Dr. Lam's teaching pace was a bit slower.

As for Ye Guibo, she is hearty, but taught like trash. Forget this woman.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute Grading, in the semester I took.

Webwork: 15%
Midterm: 35%
Final: 50%
Bonus Quizzes: +8% maximum, 2% each

【My Performance】

Webwork: full mark
Midterm: higher than mean by ~10 marks
Final: lower than mean by ~8 marks
Bonus Quizzes: < 80% correct, forgotten

Final Grade: Ｂ！

reviews.author: Sigggggggg
reviews.comment_content:
Content is the same for every class. MATH 1014 is an extension of MATH 1013.
1. Review of definite integrals, the area between curves, volumes by cross-sections
2. volume by using shell method
3. average value of function
4. arc length & area of surface rotation
5. Integration by part (M2 syllabus)
6. trigonometric substitution(M2 syllabus)
7. polar coordinates + calculus(differentiation for slope and area by integration) (2nd hardest part of 1014)
8. partial fraction
9. Approximation (midpoint rule + trapezoidal rule + Simpson's rule)
10. improper integrals
11. infinite sequence
12. series and different tests for convergence(integral test + comparison test+ alternating series test+ absolute convergence test + ratio and root tests)
13. power series and representation of functions as series
14. Taylor and Maclaurin series (hardest part of 1014)
15. 2d & 3d coordinate systems
16. vectors and scalar (M2 syllabus)
17. dot and cross product (M2 syllabus)
reviews.comment_teaching: This professor is a trap, I attended all lectures and i found out he is just reading from the book, when i read the sample in the book, that is what you can copy during class. Suggest to sit other professor like tk lam or get a copy of ho hon ming notes from your friends or senior, that will help you a lot in understanding the content involved in the class
reviews.comment_grading:
15% homework
35% midterm
50% final
* 8% bonus quiz*

For homework, normal people should get full unless they forget to do it
Midterm is dreadful as it is damn difficult, included an integration with a weird numerical answer and a polar coordinate integration which is horrible, the mean of my session is 59.86/100.
Since the mean is low (actually i think it is still higher than 1013), the panel provided bonus quiz, where you need to do before deadline around may, 8% in total, mean is 5.96/8
For final this year, it became paradise because the questions are easy af, even easier than the mock paper wtf. the mean is 71.49/100

If you get mean in every item, your mark will be 76.54/100 which is a B, ridiculous for a math course.
reviews.comment_workload:
around 1 webwork per week, just remember to do or seek help from your friends.
Bonus quiz also consumes some time as you need to work on the practice questions in order to perform the best in the bonus quiz.
Extra workload might be found on 1014 website(practice questions and additional practice questions). Both of these can help you to consolidate your understanding to hard stuff like taylor series and maclaurin series. I worked on these parts so i get 95/100 in final

reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say Avery's Lectures are boring and not too useful. He just showed the proof of the theorem and demonstrated some simple examples during his lecture but not much for the calculation technique. Attending his lecture is not useful for concrete understanding. His style in the lecture note is unreadable and hard to understand too because there are many mathematical symbols. However, if you are good in Maths and interested in the proof, you may find it helpful.

I advise the "weaker" students to go to tutorial sessions. The concept and skill will be explained well. Tutors are also easier to approach for asking questions. Moreover, the tutorial exercises are abundant for practice.

BTW, The lecture note written by Dr. Ho Hon Ming is a masterpiece. It explains the concept very clearly with diagrams and provides sufficient examples with step-by-step solution. Make sure to get a copy of it.
reviews.comment_grading:
YES! "爛Grade"!
Absolute grading! You are competing with yourself!

Grading scheme:
Webwork: 12% (online homework)
Midterm: 33%
Final Exam: 55%
Quiz*4 (Optional): extra 8% (@2%, must be done in MSC)

(For quiz and exam, please be careful for the covered topics.)
e.g. Exam will cover a lot of content (almost all) that is introduced after week 6~7 (but the final FAQ stated that all materials will be assessed.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload depends on your mathematical ability and how much effort you put.

Workload is high if you are not familiar with the concepts. You have to understand and then keep doing exercises, and cope with your assessment.

For those who is clever and genius, I have nothing to say.


Good luck.

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.title: Go for his teaching notes

reviews.author: suki suki LSM
reviews.title: MATH1014 review
reviews.comment_content:
It is more difficult than MATH 1013. However, if you have taken M2 in your secondary school, it is easier for you, especially calculating the volume, Integration by parts, Trigonometric integrals, Trigonometric substitution, and vector.

CONTENT
Chapter 6: Section 6.1 - 6.5 (Applications of Integration);   Chapter 8: Section 8.1 - 8.2 (Arc length and Surface Area)
Chapter 7: Section 7.1 - 7.8 (Integration Techniques, including improper integrals);  
Chapter 10: Section 10.3 - 10.4 (Polar coordinates and calculus)
Chapter 11: Section 11.1 - 11.11 (Infinite sequences and series, power series)
Chapter 12: Section 12.1 - 12.4 (Vectors, dot product, cross product)
(Textbook: J. Stewart, Calculus Early Transcendentals, 7th ed.)

midterm:
Area between curves
Volume
Volume by cylindrical shells
Work
Average value of a function
Arc length
Area of a surface of revolution
Integration by parts
Trigonometric integrals
Trigonometric substitution
Polar coordinates
Areas and lengths in polar coordinates
Partial fractions
Strategy for integration

final:
Approximation integration
Improper integrals
Sequences
Infinite series
Integral tests
Comparison tests
Alternating series
Absolute convergence, ratio and root tests
Testing series
Power series
Representing of functions as power series
Taylor and Maclaurin series
Application of Taylor polynomials
Three-dimensional coordinate systems
Vectors
Dot product
Cross product

reviews.author: cheese
reviews.title: Best grading ever in this semester
reviews.comment_content:
For years and years, this course is rated to be evil. I thought so too. The topics are able to be well-handled before mid-term. All you need to do is to memorize the equations for calculating arc length or trapezoidal rule, midpoint rule etc. However, I found it hard to understand some topics like polar curves and determining the convergent or divergent nature of sequence and series.
(I spent much time on studying both topics from the beginning.)
reviews.comment_teaching: Maybe she is passionate in teaching and topics are well-explained in her notes, you may find it hard to listen to her accent. It is suggested to revise the notes, but not attending the lectures. You will do just fine.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading sucks, or is it?
Perhaps it was but in this spring semester, we used absolute grading.
I got 81% plus 7% bonus marks = 88%>85%(A-)
Midterm is as hard as before (Mean 46.49, SD 19.87)
But Final is easy this time(Many people have confirmed this) (Mean around 60 marks!, SD 19.31)
I have heard friends getting 5x marks in midterm but got 95 marks in final, which turns out getting an A
reviews.comment_workload: Workload are pretty easy if you have the source. But it helps you understand topics, why not give it a try?

reviews.author: samsam2013
reviews.comment_content:
Integration of simple functions
- Displacement, Velocity, Acceleration
- Distance travelled by particle
- Future Value and Net Change

(2) Application of Integration
- Volume of solid by revolving around axis/line i.e. Disk/Shell method
- Slicing Method
- Arc Length of a curve
- Surface Area of the solid generated by revolving around axis
- Hooke's Law
- Density and Work
- Polar Coordinates and Calculus
- Area bounded by curves and Arc length of curves in Polar Coordinates
- Partial Fractions and Integration
- Estimation for the value of Finite Integration
- Improper Integrals

(3) Sequence and Series
Important content:
- Limit of a sequence
- Partial Sum, Sum of Series
- Geometric Series
- p-Series
- 8 Convergence Test of Series

(4) Application of Series
- Taylor/Maclaurin polynomials
- Binomial polynomials
- Remainder Theorem of Taylor Series

(5) Vectors

polar  coordinates  and  calculus, partial fractions.

• Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series.
• Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross products.

reviews.author: paburon
reviews.title: Best professor for ones who barely passed MATH1013
reviews.comment_content:
More calculus (mainly integrals)
Polar coordinates
Sequences and Series

- We didn't cover vectors this semester
reviews.comment_teaching:
For a student who barely passed MATH1013, I was afraid i would not be able to pass this course. But professor Wu breaks down and simplifies each topic, so it was very easy to follow and understand the content. She introduces various types of problems, and each show the calculation process step by step. So you can basically have an example guide for most questions you may encounter in homework assignments and in exams.
Her lecture slides are also very neat and detailed, so you can easily review and understand even without the class recordings, unlike some other professor's lecture notes.

However, finding a good tutorial session might be difficult, since most TA's either cannot teach, or have an uninterpretable accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is absolute grading, so you just receive based on how well you did on the midterm and final.

The avg grade for this course is a C+, but note that there are about 1200+ students taking this course. I think you wont get a bad grade if you can generally understand the content before the finals.

Midterm - 35%
Final - 55%
Homework - 10%
reviews.comment_workload: The only homework are 10 webWork assignments, so the workload is not that bad. They've apparently reduced the content load compared to previous years, but honestly it was still a lot of content to go through

reviews.author: Best
reviews.comment_content:
Topics to be covered
1. Review on differentiations, integrations and Fundamental theorem of Calculus (1). Area between curves. Volumes by cylindrical shells. (2, 3)
2. Work (4), Averages value of a function (5)
3. Integration-by-parts (6), Trigonometric substitution, hyperbolic functions and applications (7)
4. Integration by Partial fractions (8), Trigonometric integrals I (9),
5. Trigonometric integrals II (10), Arc lengths, Area of a surface of revolution, Polar coordinates (11)
6. Polar arc lengths and areas; Parametrizations (12), Approximate integration (13)
7. Improper integrals (14), Sequences (15)
8. Mid-semester examination (26thSunday morning). Infinite series; Integral test (16); Comparison test; Alternating series (17)
9. Absolute convergence, Ratio and Root tests (18); Power series (19)
10. Representation of functions as power series (20); Taylor and Maclaurin series;  Applications of Taylor polynomials (21);
11. Vectors (22), Dot product (23);
12. Cross product and applications (24)
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches at a comfortable pace, making it easy to follow along. He frequently utilizes the whiteboard, so make sure to sit towards the front of the class in order to see the words clearly. Attendance is not mandatory, as he uploads all material, including written notes, onto Canvas. Additionally, he enjoys going beyond the curriculum, delving into topics like hyperbolic functions. If you're interested in this kind of material, I would highly recommend taking his course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is quite tough. It follows an absolute grading scale with slight adjustments every semester. However, if you do poorly on the midterm, even if you do well on the final exam (nearly 100%), it may not necessarily lead to an A range grade. This semester's midterm was especially challenging, particularly the final question. Unfortunately, I lost 20 marks on this question because I had trouble connecting parts a, b, c, and d.


Assessment

0% Worksheets (Done in tutorials)

10% WebWorks

35% by Mid-semester exam

55% by final exam

Rough divisions: A+/A/A- > 85.5 > B+/B/B- >70.5 > C+/C/C- > 50.5 > D > 40
reviews.comment_workload:
To succeed in this course, it is important to complete the online WeBWork exercises on a biweekly basis. The good news is that you have infinite attempts, so you should be able to achieve full marks. While reviewing past papers can help you familiarize yourself with the content, it's important to remember that they don't necessarily reflect your performance on exams.

Overall, staying consistent with the exercises and engaging with the material will help you excel in this course.

i think is fair grading for a year1 math course, but not so as a GENERAL math couse.
if you study through the materials and you understand the concepts well (there was quite a long question in the final that is not as ordinary as other question where you have to apply concepts in the syllabus, but not just like some high school exams that they have some fixed question types), you can get through the midterm and exams with ease. however this 1000-level couse is mainly for students that are not major in mathematics or so. the exam questions it might be too demanding for those that simply wanted good grades and dont care about math at all. it feels like those that set the questions wanted all students to fully grasp the content and can apply on almost all questions easily, but in reality many that are not major in math could hardly understand the concepts without spending a lot of time in it.
___

i didnt care at all so i spent 2 days before midterm and final respectively, just to learn everything back and do the past papers provided. pp is good reference but if you strive for good grades you need to get prepared for some long question that are not standard.

reviews.author: SunGamePlay
reviews.title: A worthy course for (potential) Math Major.
reviews.comment_content:
This review is for L1 (Math Major) section only,

It might not applicable to you.

This course cover content from Integration to Geometry, Sequences and Series.

Compare to other section, L1 focus more on logic.

Compare to 1024, L1 logic is less rigorous.

Before midterm, L1 covers only Integration,

from Integration = finding area under the curve, to Riemann sum, Riemann Integrable,

computation ,Integration techniques and improper Integration

After midterm, L1 begins with Geometry,

Just like reviewing Vector in HKDSE M2 Vector, Plus finding arc length, surface area.

Then to Sequences and Series.

The main idea is like to discuss, when will a sequences or series converges.

Then if they converges, how can we find the value of it.

Also, It contain special series like Taylor Series and Fourier Series.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ivan is definitely a good instructor, he speaks clearly, shows the logic behind each theorem,

provides good example for you to have a better understanding. Moreover, his lesson is full of joy,

which is very rare for a Mathematics course that usually make you boring.)

Meanwhile, Jonathan is also a good tutor.

In his tutorial, you can see he try very hard to tell you how to deal with different questions.

You are free to ask him, and (if possible) he will reply you in Cantonese to make things more clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Ivan Mean Value Theorem :

Forall difficulty of the exam,

Mean of the exam is always around 40.

Ivan exam is hard, but the cutoff is also lower.

The grading is as you can expected from L1

It allow you to have one of the two method,

to help you get a better score even if you mess up one exam.

The methods are as follow,

Method 1 : 20% HW + 40% Midterm + 40% Final

Method 2 : 20% HW + 10% Midterm + 70% Final

The method with higher course score would be used.

Cutoff :

A+ : 82.32

A : 73.06

A- : 65.24

B+ : 54.99

B : 48.65

B- : 44.52

C+ : 39.67

C : 34.99

C- : 29.69

HW Mean : 75.92

Midterm Mean : 41.55

Final Mean : 40.94

(Getting mean = B)

Also since I audit 1024 at the same time,

It is (not accurate) that , 1024 B ~ 1014 A
reviews.comment_workload:
I have to mention the workload is not low,

There are 10 questions set that you have to finish,

Each takes you around 3 ~ 6 hours to finish,

reviews.comment_grading:
20% Worksheets (Done in tutorials)
0% WebWorks
25% by Mid-semester exam  
55% by final exam

Mid-term mean: 39/80
Final mean: 30.23/100
Final SD: 15.09
Total SD: 15.37
As you see, the final is really difficult and no calculator is allowed, so much more challenging than you thought. The question is more or less related to the worksheet in the tutorial, so better revised them.
The grading of the worksheet is like this. The full mark of each worksheet is 2. As long as you write something on it, you got 1 point. If you write some steps and try to finish some of the questions, you got the full mark. If you were absent or didn't submit, you got a 0. I think going to the tutorial and submitting those worksheets really help to save some points.
reviews.comment_workload: Because Webwork does not have any grading, the workload is not high. The most time-consuming thing is still the revision part. Nearly no workload

The content includes:

3. Work Done

5. Polar Coordinate (length, area)
----- midterm exam -----
6. Numerical Integration (Trapezium, Mid-point, Simpson)
7. Improper Integration
8. Sequence and series
(convergence, epsilon-delta, integral test, limit convergent test, root test, alternating series test)
9. Power Series and Taylor Series (radius of convergence, Maclaurin expansion)
(the most difficult topic I think)
10. Vectors (dot product, cross product)

reviews.author: TJer
reviews.comment_content:
Basically what taught in spring semester and fall semester, but all taught in 4 weeks.
The first week would be Derivatives and Antiderivatives, Definite Integrals and Area Between Curves, and More Applications of Definite Integrals.
The Second week would be Integration Techniques, Integration by Parts, and More Applications of Integrals and Polar Coordinates and Calculus.
The third week would be Numerical Integration and Improper Integrals,
Infinite Sequences and Series and Tests for Convergence/Divergence of Series
The Fourth week would be  Power Series, Taylor and Maclaurin Series and Vectors in 2D and 3D Space(Vector is not included in the exam)
reviews.comment_teaching: The TA and professor will not do any teaching during the lesson, but more like a personal tutor , they solve the problem and teach the method when you ask them. Do not hesitate if you have any problems, they are willing(probably) to help, and it does help the classwork workload.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% for classwork
20% for quiz
60% for the final exam
Grade scale(total score):
A+/A/A- : 94/88/82
B+/B/B- > 82/74/66
C+/C/C- > 66/58/47
For references, I got 71.57 out of 100, in between B- and B. and I got B.
reviews.comment_workload:
The Classwork.usually consist of 10-20 questions. It should be done in the class, roughly for 3 hours.
Professors can reopen the previous classwork if you request(During the class)
After every lesson, there will be a quiz, which usually consist of 5-6 question and need to be finished in about 55 minutes.
Overall, really not hard to get high marks in both quizzes and classwork.
However, it is recommended to find tutorials online before taking the class, as it would be really hard to catch the paste if you have never studied calculus 2 before hand.

reviews.author: Tiff-TIFF
reviews.comment_content:
-Review of definite integrals and the fundamental theorem of calculus.
-Fractional integration, trigonometric integration, trigonometric algebra, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions.
-Mathematical integrals, improper integrals.
-Area of the area between curves, volume of a slice, and cylindrical shells.
-Length of curves, surface area, work, average of functions.
-Numerical and infinite series, divergence and integration, ratios, roots and comparison tests, alternating series.
-Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series.
-Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot product, cross product.
reviews.comment_teaching: Notes are very neat and helpful for revision
reviews.comment_grading:
10% by online homework
35% by the midterm exam
55% by final exam
or
10% by online homework
90% by final exam

Very important to do your homework seriously!!!
Very important to do your homework seriously!!!
Very important to do your homework seriously!!!

OK for me.
Attendance is not counted.
Homework can redo until you get 100%

reviews.author: MintChoco
reviews.title: 操數真係好重要
reviews.comment_content:
mainly integrals, 有sequence, series, polar coordinates (though these are all related to integral at the end)， can refer to other posts for details
vectors are also taught, but some lectures cannot finish the topic before the final exam, so that topic was excluded from the final exam (the homework on that topic was also optional and not counted towards the final grade)
有部份topic 都同DSE M2 有關係，但係唔好靠有M2底，因為比1013多唔少M2無教既嘢
(本人就係想靠M2底而差啲PK既人辦)
reviews.comment_teaching:
其實佢個人係nice 既，唔明問佢佢都好願意堂上即時解答，但係英文啲口音就比較難follow, 最記得我聽佢個"obviously"(應該係)聽咗半個sem 先估到
同埋佢會擺兩份notes上Canvas, 一份係blank你可以寫嘢，一份係有佢堂上手寫既notes (但係唔鼓勵大家淨係睇嗰份而唔上堂/唔take notes)
reviews.comment_grading:
there are two methods for grading this semester:
Method 1: Homework 10% + Midterm 35% + Final 55%
Method 2: Homework 10% + Midterm 0% + Final 90%
Getting full marks for homework should be easy, as you can try infinitely many times until you get it all correct
我midterm 35, 所以係用Method 2, Final 之前嗰個禮拜狂操數，包括Classviva 題目 + tutorial題目 + 1014 past paper + 014 past paper, 操到Final 88, A Grade
兩個grading method應該係因為Midterm份卷真係難到黐咗線搞到全世界都勁低分，然後 Lam Tsz Kin就出email 話兩個grading method，而Final 份卷應該係淺咗既 (亦都可能係因為我操咗成個禮拜數)
reviews.comment_workload:
around 10 Homework on Classviva, people who have taken 1013 should be familiar with it
Can use online calculators to help, can be not very time consuming

reviews.author: Martin.Chau
reviews.comment_content:
1.Review Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
2.Integration by parts, polar coordinates and calculus and partial fractions.
3.Numerical integration and improper integrals
4.Area and volume
5.Length of curves, surface area, work, the average value of a function

reviews.comment_content:
Simple calculus, quite easy, other math courses are more difficult
Week 1: Monday  (Feb 1)
Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (4.1-4.3)
Substitution Method (4.4)
Week 2: Monday (Feb 8)
Integrating by parts (4.5)
Lunar New Year Holidays: Feb12-15
Week 3: Monday (Feb 15)  
Trigonometric integrals (4.6)
The method of partial fractions (4.6)
Week 4: Monday (Feb 22)
Numerical integration (4.7)
Improper integrals (4.8)
Week 5: Monday (Mar 1)
Areas between curves (5.1)
Volumes by slicing (5.2)
Week 6: Monday (Mar 8)
Volume by cylindrical shells (5.2)
Arc lengths and surface areas (5.3,  5.4)
Week 7: Monday (Mar 15)
Polar coordinates and calculus (5.5)
Work (5.7)
Week 8: Monday (Mar 22)
Infinite sequences and series (6.1, 6.2)
Week 9: Monday (Mar 29)
Integral test (6.3)
Comparison tests (6.4)
Alternating series (6.5)
Term break: Apr 31 - Apr 6
Week 10: Monday (Apr 12)
Absolute and conditional convergence (6.5)
Taylor and Maclaurin series (7.1)
Week 11: Monday (Apr 19)
Representation of functions as power series (7.2)
Interval of convergence of a power series (7.3)
Week 12: Monday (Apr 26)
Applications of Taylor series (7.4)
Three dimensional coordinate systems
Vectors
Labor Day: May 1
Week 13: Monday (May 3)
Dot product
Cross product
Study Break: May 10-14

Textbook: J. Hu, W.-P. Li, Y. Wu, Calculus for scientists and engineers with matlab.

Additional Reference for Vectors: J. Stewart's, Calculus Early Transcendentals, section 12.1-12.4.

reviews.comment_content: It is just teaching the remaining parts of the textbook of MATH1013, so I think it is easy to follow if you study hard in MATH1013.

As he involve in writing the book, so he will just teach the concept by using the example in the book.
He will answer students' question and sometimes teaching something or some techniques that are out of syllabus.
Generally, I am quite enjoy having his classes.

HW 10%
Midterm 35%
Final 55%/90%

For me, I am the one that save my grade under this scheme, as my midterm only getting 3X/100.

reviews.author: ltxtftrsn
reviews.title: Terrible experience
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair attitude from Professor Jishan HU, though the pace of teaching is hard to catch with internet delays. Terrible attitude from other instructors and professors, if you have never heard of the email that the almighty Professor Tsz Kin LAM has sent scolding off students not taking the mid-term as a strategy (myself not being one of those) and for students complaining about the terribly hard mid-term examination.
reviews.comment_grading: Terrible grading policy, it was announced that the absolute grading system is to be adopted even when the mean of the course is a failing score. Taking this course in an online mode is a nightmare, as the exam time limits are extremely tight and unlike in F2F exams, students cannot personally adjust their working time on different questions as each long question has a fixed and limited exam time.
reviews.comment_workload: Medium workload until exams come, the revision makes it hell worse.

reviews.author: painkiller
reviews.title: 自求多福
reviews.comment_content:
advanced m2, but not vector and matrix

-volume by slicing, shell, disk
-integration by part

-polar coordinate
-sequence and series

if you are local and did'nt take m2 in high school, you may need to spend much more time to understand those stuff

skipped classes, notes are enough. Her notes are very clear and tidy.
but I still recommend to take classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
shit

the difficulty for midterm is medium(in my opinion) and the final is much more easier, maybe ltk received too many complaint eamils
reviews.comment_workload: 1 webwork per week, very light workload, it takes about 1.5 hours. If you feel you're good enough and know everything already, just skip these shit by Wolfram Alpha.You can practice by doing the exercises on classviva, and it is also recommended to do the questions daily.

reviews.author: kckck
reviews.comment_content:
Typical lectures. Top down teaching. No attendance required.
Typical tutorials. Short recall of taught content and solve related problems. No attendance required.

Covers a lot about integrals and series, such as integral approximations, and convergence and divergence of series and sum of series. Ends with vectors, which is purely M2 stuff, but it wasn't covered in the final exam as other professors could not manage to go through the topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Accent might be a bit to heavy to local students, but I personally think it is fine. She is good relatively when compared to other professors. Notes are provided on canvas, so you do not have to worry much about missing out any info in class. They are also very useful for revision purposes.

I know there are other professors who use whiteboards (physical ones) and students have to copy everything frantically to make sure they have everything in their notes before the professor clears the whiteboard anytime soon.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.

Midterm more difficult than final. Grading scheme was changed after the midterm to allow the exclusion of midterm results, accounting for 90% of the total grade. Remaining 10% from assignments.

Assignments same as MATH1013, unlimited attempts for assignments with the support from the math support center if needed. As long as you do them you can get full marks for the assignment part.

overall score of about 83-84% is already enough for A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable, an assignment every 1 to 2 weeks on average. Usually between 10 to 15 questions per assignment. However, there may be questions with parts a, b, c, d... so the workload fluctuates from week to week. Easy ones require 1-2 hours, while difficult ones can take up to 8 hours to complete.

reviews.author: Kya Wang
reviews.title: Math 1014
reviews.comment_content: Most of it is integrals, including things like area integrals and volume integrals, which will be relatively easy for those of you who have taken M2. In addition, there are some knowledge about limits. If you take classes seriously and do more questions after class, you can carry it.
reviews.comment_teaching: TK lectured very well and patiently answered every student's questions. Although he sometimes makes some mistakes in his calculations.
reviews.comment_grading: easy to get B level, but a little bit difficult to get A level.
reviews.comment_workload: Not quite large, there is only one homework per week, which can be used as knowledge consolidation.

reviews.author: AlexJ95
reviews.title: Easy to pass if you do past paper as many as possible but forgetting about tutorial
reviews.comment_content:
This course requires accurate hand computation. I think it is quite tedious, but It is unavoidable because there are many calculators that can calcuate in/dydx directly.

 Inde nte integrals, substitution method, integration by parts, trigonometric integrals,
trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor's accent is easy to understand but he speaks a sentence intermittently to pretend that his English is great.
I would rather he slows down the pace of speaking.

His lecture is fair, but somehow I have to read another math book to understand the course material.

He is willing to answer student's question.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to pass but hard to get a decent grade.
Gain and effect you spend on this course is not 1:1.
33% can pass this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
10% Webwork(Total 10 webwork/ around 2 weeks/1 webwork)
90% Final

The workload is light if you aim pass to B- range.

If you don't want to fail this course, I suggest you download past paper and do it early.

More calculus

Integrals, Integration by parts, Trigonometric integrals, Polar coordinates, Areas and arc lengths in polar coordinate, Sequences, infinite series

Not in exam of this semester:
Vectors, Dot product, Cross-product
reviews.comment_teaching:
This course depends heavily on self-study. Professors are just here to provide you with some example questions, tricks & other materials for you to learn.
Tutorial is way better than the lectures, make sure you attend them. This seems to be the first semester the teaching in UG course, she put a lot time answering our questions. thanks Chuqi
reviews.comment_grading:
2 schemes in this semester
A. 35% midterm + 55% final + 10% Classviva
B. 90% final + 10% Classviva

below mean in both exams + 10% Classviva -> C-
I guess this is acutely using abustle grading



As others have said, if you are reading this deep in reviews, the course is likely required. And you probably have two more math courses to go.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework on classviva almost every single week, 10 in total
Auto graded by the system, multiple retries before the deadline.

1 week homework break before each exams
You will need it to study for both of the exams, they expect you to work through the questions like a calculator

reviews.author: Henryw0ng
reviews.title: Normal content, hard exam
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly about intergration

-definite/indefeinte intergrals
-Convergence, divergence
-Sequences,series
-Taylor/Malcalaruian series

The first few chapters are easy, but the later chapters (after mid term are difficult) You'll probably need to watch other sources to get better understanding
reviews.comment_teaching:
While the professor is nice and asks questions, she mostly doing the ppt reading. Don't hesitate to ask her about anything you don't understand.

She provides notes which either are completed or you can write your own, so I think it's pretty good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.

I got B for 73/100

last semester has two grading systems, takes one with higher total score:
#1 Homework 20%
     Mid term 35%
     Final 55%
#2 (For those who didn't take/or tanked the mid term)
     Homework 10%
     Final 90%

No need to worry about others, just do your best. (Again, Mid term hard, Final easier)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is decent, however, the homework is not enough to help you familarize all the topics. Be sure to do past papers to get good grades.

reviews.author: Steven Kwan
reviews.title: Easy course but not easy to get good grade
reviews.comment_content: Same as other review. In my opinion, there are many useless stuff, but easy to understand. But for this semester, vector was not included in the final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: LTK's teaching is very boring, you will probably sleep on the class. But to be honest, he can still explain some important concept clearly. By the way, he always get some careless mistake on calculation, so just trust that he get mistake again if you think that it is wrong.
reviews.comment_grading: Not good grade bro, if you meet the mean (around 60%), you can only get C+ or C. Even if you get 80%, only B or B+. For me, I got only 83% and therefore get B+. So if you want to get good grade, work hard and don't get any careless mistake.
reviews.comment_workload: For me, the workload is extremely light since many of the topics can be learnt on the internet, you can finish your homework rapidly if you can understand. And there are about 1 assignment per week, so not harsh.

reviews.author: Shing Hei
reviews.comment_content: Pretty interesting, follow up to MATH1012 but on steroids

You should really just teach yourself the content as the lecturers do not really put enough adequate examples to prepare you for the midterms or final exams.

Just do some pastpapers to prepare for the midterms or final exams.
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty hard as it is absolute grading which means that most people tend to be in the C/D range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not bad apart from the webwork but usually extensions are given and examples of similar questions to do.

reviews.author: ggg_
reviews.comment_content:
Following what you learnt in 1013
• Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
• Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions.
• Numerical integration, improper integrals.
• Area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells.
• Length of curves, surface area, work, average value of a function.
• Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series.
• Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series.
• Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross products.

Vectors are excluded from the fnial exam and the corresponding homework wasn't counted either as some professors didn't have time to cover that part in the end.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually his notes are quite good, but his English is so poor that he almost failed to explain anything and answer students' questions. It is ok for someone that is not bad at math(have good foundations) and likes self-studying, or someone that has previewed the contents in advance. Otherwise you may feel a bit hopeless. In that case, you may contact TA more and see if he can help you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Originally, it should be 10%homework+35%midterm+55%final, but due to the pandemic situation, some people didn't take miterm using infection as an excuse. Finally, the grading scheme switched to taking the best from (10%homework+35%midterm+55%final) or (10%homework+90%final)
Maybe you should aim for overall 90 to get A or A+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite big. There are 9 classviva homeworks in total, and you also have to spend time digesting the contents, doing tutorial exercises, doing pastpapers to get good grades cuz the homework didn't help much in the exam...... Especially for the midterm. I felt like I knew everything after doing the homework but it is quite different in the exam.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecturer: Zheng Yizhong

佢個D lecture note係自己手寫ge，D字其實寫得幾靚。講書ge話就一般般，把口冇咁清晰，冇乜口音，可能英文一般，所以講得唔流暢。雖然把口冇咁好，但佢講concept同解formula ge時候，我完全跟到，而且get到！！！Step by step慢慢解，又清晰又詳細，就睇你接唔接受到佢D英文。

仲有，佢好樂意解答問題，上堂問 or email佢都ok。但注意佢有兩個email，use this 'mayzheng@ust.hk' instead of this 'xhzheng@ust.hk' （試過sd去後者，結果0覆）而且，考試前佢都會俾D 'tips'，有少少廢話，但的确對考試有用，吹佢唔脹。

Ultimately got a B.(76.X/100)

If you really want an A, finish at least half of the problemset on classviva (~1000 questions). Then pray to the goddess of luck.
I did half of them. So naturally it follows that goddess of luck despises me.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment is easy,
but I will be lying to you if workload in this godforsaken school depends on assignments.
If we express the time spent on assignments and the time spent on Classviva problemset as infinite series A and B respectively, and we compute the limit of A/B where n goes to infinity.
We can clearly see that the limit converges to 0. The proof will cost you two subgrade if you offended the goddess of luck.

reviews.author: gyy
reviews.comment_content:
The first half of the content is very useful since it involves applications, however, the last half of the content left me in the wonder about the use case. Vector is covered in not much detail.

 Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.   
 Velocity and net change, area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells.
 Length of curves, surface area, and work.   
 Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus,
partial fractions.
 Numerical integration, improper integrals.
 Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series.
 Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series.
 Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross products.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very passionate about Mathematics. I got a chance to have a conversation with him about math and he seems to be very interested in the topic, especially on complex numbers. I read some reviews about the professor before and some people commented about how he is very bad at English. However, after taking the course, I feel like it is not as bad as people have described, so I guess he improved on his English.

During the first half of the course, the professor explains concepts clearly. However, during the last half, the topics became harder and the concept is not explained as clearly as before. Maybe since more and more people disappear and it is discouraging for the professor. After the midterm exam, most of what the professor explains in the lecture is not clear and helpful as before.

The professor also make a lot of mistakes in his lecture notes so don't rely too much on it, although he will later correct his mistakes later onward

reviews.author: sungjun
reviews.title: goood teaching
reviews.comment_content:
- Integration techniques: fundamental theorem of calculus, substitution rules, trigonometric identities and trigonometric integrals, integration by parts, partial fractions, numerical integration, etc..
- Improper integrals: evaluation, convergence and divergence problems.
- Applications of integrals: areas, volumes by slicing and cylindrical shells, arc lengths and areas of surfaces of revolution, work done, average value of a continuous function, calculus in polar coordinates.
- Infinte sequences and series: limit of an infinite sequence, convergence and divergence an infinite series, geometric series, various convergence/divergence tests, alernating series.
- Power series: interval of convergence and radius of convergence of a power series, Taylor and Maclaurin series of functions, operations of power series, such as adding, substituting, differentiating or integration power series.
- Vectors (WAS NOT IN FINAL DUE TO CORONA SEMESTER)
reviews.comment_teaching: Really good teaching skills and a lot of workload
reviews.comment_grading:
The weightage is as follows:
Homeworks: 25%
Final Exam: 75%
reviews.comment_workload: Honestly, this course requires a constant workload since there was one homework assignment or the other almost every week. This course requires solid knowledge from MATH1012/1013 so don't forget the content, more notably integration, disk/washers method, volumes, areas and Riemann sums since they are the basis of 1014 content.

reviews.author: Twcheng
reviews.comment_content:
If BDSM is your thing, then you'll enjoy this. You get to learn all sorts of ways to torture yourself you didn't even know existed!!! From the light and kinky stuff like volumes of revolution to the hardcore and masochistic stuff like series expansions and partial fractions expansions.

Okay, in all seriousness, it's Calculus 2 for those who follow the US curriculum. You learn integration techniques for the first half then you go on to learning series, sequences etc in the second half. I'm sure it's useful stuff, but still hard none the less.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Extremely difficult to understand what he's saying. He has about a 1:1 ratio of filler words to actual words when "teaching". So when he teaches it goes something like this "uhh, so uhhh, today we will ummm, be talking about uhhh integration by errrr parts. To uhhhh integrate........" When I heard that on the first class, I knew that I was in for a very bad time.

Basically non-existent teaching. Instructor blitz through the content like there's no tomorrow. If you go to class, you can only hope to learn something through osmosis, because you'll be furiously taking notes that you'll never read/won't understand or you'll give up half way and just start playing with your phone or flirting with the girl next to you. Which you can then flex your intelligence and show her how much you've self learned.

To rub salt into the wound, you get NDS students who seem to understand everything to the point where they can even correct the instructor's careless mistakes. fml. If they're that good, why even go to class??
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute bullshit. You get essentially a bi-modal distribution where you have us double digit IQ locals getting 30/100 and you have the 10% of students who say that this course was a breeze and get 90+/100 for everything. Mid term and final was a bloodbath
reviews.comment_workload: The only redeeming thing about this course is the workload. The only continuous assessment that is given is the infamous webwork. However, the webwork gives you unlimited tries so you can slowly guess your way through each assesment which takes only about 1.5-2 hours each on average. Or you could Wolfram Alpha that shit and be done in 15 minutes if you don't give a damn about learning the material.

reviews.comment_teaching: I think those lectures are kind of useless because they just follow his handwritten notes and copy once in the lecture.

This course is extremely hard for people who haven't learn M2 before. It is really tough to learn and "master" all the content within one semester.

But for those Calculus beginners, if you really wish to get a high grade in this course, you just need to spend some time doing some extra Calculus questions to build up your skills.

Volume by cylindrical shells (5.2)
Arc lengths and surface areas (5.3,  5.4)
Week7:
Polar coordinates and calculus (5.5)
Work (5.7)
Week8:
Infinite sequences and series (6.1, 6.2)
Week9:
Integral test (6.3)
Comparison tests (6.4)
Alternating series (6.5)
Week10:
Absolute and conditional convergence (6.5)
Taylor and Maclaurin series (7.1)
Week11:
Representation of functions as power series (7.2)
Interval of convergence of a power series (7.3)
Week12:
Applications of Taylor series (7.4)
Three-dimensional coordinate systems
Vectors
Week13 (Not covered in the final exam):
Dot product
Cross product

Basic Cal2 stuff nothing special.
The contents in week 13 are not covered in the final exam but still, we had h.w. about them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Personally, I think professor Ye is great.

She offers blank lecture notes and full lecture notes. The blank one is really helpful if you study the contents before the class and even reviewing them after class.

Also, she gives students time to solve some example problems during the lectures. Further, she asks some important questions for students which is helpful for understanding the math concepts in this course.

Among many professors who teach this course, I would definitely recommend others to listen to professor Ye's lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
-ClassViva homework (25%)-

Unlimited attempts, make sure to get full marks.
The calculations can be a little messy compare to proper exam questions.

The questions are not that hard but if you don't know how to solve certain questions don't hesitate to google them.

-Final exam (75%)-
Consisted of three parts, 45min each

Overall, it was not that hard but some questions related to the series(application of Taylor & Maclaurin series) were a bit hard. If someone sees this, make sure to input more effort on that topic.

Usually, the hardest part in Cal2 might be the work problems. However, this semester, there were no hard problems related to work. It was way too easy. Somewhat disappointing frankly.

The grading seems to be similar to absolute and it might be because there's no statement that this course is graded by the curve in the syllabus.

So overall 85%+ you'll get an A range

ClassViva H.W. (100/100, mean: 95.0)
Final exam (88/100, mean: 64.5)

Overall: A (91%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Do homework regularly and study in advance and also review it after class.
If so, you would have no problem getting a good grade for this course.

Some tips might be to take some extra time on practicing the math series application topic.

Grade: 88% A- (Mean: 74.76)

Definite integral, improper integrals, curves and parametric equations, solving infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series.  

In simple terms, this course is M2+sequence and series. All other topics you have learned in secondary school, so it should be easy for those who have taken M2. 1014 is definitely more difficult compared to 1013 as there is more material to cover.



The vector part was taught in a week but wasn't included in the exam

reviews.author: yeet420
reviews.comment_content:
Review of definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Integration by parts, trigonometric integrals, trigonometric substitutions, polar coordinates and calculus, partial fractions.
Numerical integration, improper integrals.
Area of a region between curves, volume by slicing and cylindrical shells.
Length of curves, surface area, work, average value of a function.
Sequences and infinite series, divergence and integral, ratio, root and comparison tests, alternating series.
Taylor polynomials, power series and Taylor series.
Vectors in two and three dimensions, dot products, cross products.
reviews.comment_teaching: Get ready to teach yourself everything, insanely difficult to pay attention in lectures as the professor is extremely dull. Just reads off prepared lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
75% Final Exam
25% Online Homeworks (10 HW sets)
Midterm was not held this semester due to covid.

My scores:
HW: 100% (Mean ~ 88%)
Final: 60% (Mean ~ 65%)
Total: 10%
Final Grade: B-

Grading seems fair but final exam is too important, they should have included a midterm or made the HW a little more significant.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload isn't too bad, the 10HW sets are spread out fairly evenly throughout the semester. You'll have roughly 1-1.5 weeks to complete each.

Make sure to complete every set and try to get 100% for all since it's an easy way to secure at least 25%.

reviews.author: FatBoyEatCGrade

reviews.comment_content: Nothing different with the other reviews.

You better attend the lesson and do more exercises..
reviews.comment_grading:
The webwork is 25%  
the final is 75% ( just MC questions)

I get the very first C range in my university life. No calculus background in secondary school.  

I have finished all the webwork. Then just skim through one past paper then go to the examination.
I haven't do any additional exercise for practice.

I don't think I have did a bad job in the final. Maybe due to lack of practices , I make a lot of mistake during the calculation.

> I heard that the exam question types are quite similar every year.

> The grading scheme is likely to have an absolute one.  So. you better have a good preparation for the final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.
You just have to finish some webwork, You may need to spend some hours doing it if you don't understand well enough or familiarize with the calculus technique.

If you don't have calculus background in secondary school and want to get a good grade. Make sure you have enough practice for every sections and do more past papers if you have time.

It is all about practice, the question types are all the way similar.

reviews.author: Patricknely
reviews.title: Self-learning is the way to get a good grade
reviews.comment_content:
All the topics can be found in the Prof. Hu's book.

>Contents
1. Reviews on integration taught in 1013.
2. Trigonometric integrals
3. Improper Integrals
4. Applications of integrations
> 4.1 Areas between curves
> 4.2 Volumes obtained by rotation
> 4.3 Arc length and Surface areas
> 4.4 Polar Coordinates
5. Infinite sequences and series
6. Taylor and Maclaurin Series
7. Interval of convergence of a power series
8. Vectors (not included in the final exam this semester)
reviews.comment_teaching:
>Teaching:
Reading and copying the course material throughout the whole semester.
>Prof:
Prof Li is kind enough to answer my questions and help me solve the problems timely a few times.

It's totally fine if you skip all the classes. But
remember to look through the lecture notes and the textbook, so that you can learn all by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
> Grading
25% HW ( there are 10 HW sets )
75% Final ( 25 Multiple choices )

> Grades
Everyone can achieve 100% in the 10 HW sets by attempting infinitely times.
In final, if you fail 1 question or less, you will get A+
If you fail 2 questions, you will get an A
If you get Mean (~~ 5/6 fails) , you will get B
reviews.comment_workload: In each HW set, you are expected to spend 3 ~ 4 hours (difficult one, ~1 to 2 hours to complete an easy one) to complete one Homework set. You can try million times to improve your score to 100%.

reviews.author: cchau
reviews.comment_content: The course materials are well organized. It is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the second in the MATH 1013 – MATH 1014 sequence. Topics include applications of definite integral, improper integrals, vectors, curves and parametric equations, modeling with differential equations, solving simple differential equations, infinite sequences and series, power series and Taylor series. The most difficult part should be the series and improper integrals, but in general if you are interested in math you will enjoy this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: His voice is loud enough for you to concentrate.
reviews.comment_grading: The weight of the final exam was adjusted to double at that time, allowing marginal cases to get better grades
reviews.comment_workload: Need to practice a lot in order to get good results.

reviews.author: Agust_0309
reviews.title: MATH 1014
reviews.comment_content: Integration techniques, Improper integrals, Applications of integrals, Infinte sequences and series, Power series
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor was quite nice, he really cares about students' learning progress.
He would ask constantly  whether we have any questions, and he would try to explain once again when there is any questions.
Sometimes he would also share his experience, which made our classmates more focused on what he is saying.
However, people are more likely to response when he is talking about his past instead of teaching, so it might not help us in understanding the lecture.
Also, we are having lessons with zoom in this semester, but he was still using a PHYSICAL WHITEBOARD in his room. It might be because he did not know how to use a virtual whiteboard, but the main point is that, it was really blur af, we could barely see what did he write, so it was quite hard to catch up.
Right, we could ask him questions when we do not understand, but he barely looks at the chatroom in zoom.
We all prefer to type in chatroom to ask questions, 'cause turning on a mic and speak was really awkward, I hope everyone would understand this. BUT, he doesn't look at the chatroom even he was sitting in front of the computer silently and waiting for questions. Some of us might be more brave so they would speak and ask, however the professor would always return us with a sentence "I don't know what you don't understand". Yea, we also don't know what we don't understand but we just can't get the idea, that's why we are asking the question lol.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got full marks in all assignments, but I got only 45/100 in final.
The marks distribution was assignment 25%, final 75%.
And I got a C at the end.
I thought I could get a slightly higher grade with full marks in assignment, but seems my final score really dragged my grade down so much.
reviews.comment_workload:
It was alright.
We got 10 assignments in total.
Although Classviva always crack, our professor helped us to extend our deadline, so sufficient working time was guaranteed.
I used to try those assignments out right after it is released, so I can do everything when the server is not overloaded. (I could have more time to work on wrong answers too.
